_header: Little children here you may lere / Much courtesy that is reckoned here
Subjects: children, instructions for behavior of; manners, treatises on; courtesy books; instruction
_description: ‘The Lytylle Childrenes Lytil Boke’ — fifty-four couplets

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Litill children here may ye lernepetitz enfanz icy vous pouez
                    aprendre…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…& in his last end with þe swete Ihesus& en la
                    dereniere fin auec le doux Ihesus
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
The boke of / Curtasie (p. 289); Here endith þe boke of Curtasie (p.
                    291)

CULEe435a.First Lines:
Lytyl Childernhere yow may lereMeche cortesey þat ys rekeyd
                    hereffor clarkys þat the vij artes con…
CULEe435a.Last Lines:
…And ȝyff hem & vs gras yn gey to besey all amen ffor
                    chereyte

BLEge1995.First Lines:
LItylle chyldrynne here may ye lereMoche curtesy that ys wretyn
                    here…
BLEge1995.Last Lines:
…And vs graunte in Ioy to a bydeSay ye alle Amen for charyde
                    in euery syde
BLEge1995.Attributed Title:
HEre endythe the boke of Curtesy that ys fulle necessary vnto yonge
                    chyldren that muste nedys lerne the maner of curtesy (f. 60)

BLHar541.First Lines: Lytyll chyldren here ye may lereMoche curtesy þat is wrytyn here…
BLHar541.Last Lines: …Bulk not as a Beone were yn þi throte[tear in sheet]rle þat comys oute of a cote
